Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The cumulative incidence of serum creatinine levels > 50 % above normal was 33 % after 96 weeks .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| serum creatinine levels > 50 % above normal |

Explanation:

The term "serum creatinine levels > 50 % above normal" is the only disease-related entity in the paragraph. Creatinine is a waste product that's produced by your normal muscle metabolism. Elevated creatinine levels can indicate reduced kidney function or kidney disease. Therefore, it is a disease entity.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| serum creatinine levels > 50 % above normal |

Explanation:

The only disease-related entity in the paragraph is "serum creatinine levels > 50 % above normal". The cumulative incidence refers to the proportion of a population that will develop a condition over a specified period. In this case, the condition is elevated serum creatinine levels, which can indicate kidney disease. Therefore, it is a disease entity. The other terms in the paragraph, such as "cumulative incidence" and "after 96 weeks," do not refer to diseases.
